mobs.long_desc: A giant crystal crab tries to get you with its pincers!
mobs.desc: Its outsized crystal claws make a sound that makes your hair stand on end. It's creeping up at you in a slow sideways motion, pointing its gruesome eyes-on-stalks at you.

mobs.long_desc: A zombie in a captain's uniform turns to face you.
mobs.desc: The bones of this undead captain are visible in places.  He can find no rest until he has completed his mission, but his brain long ago lost the ability to remember what that mission was.

mobs.long_desc: A man dressed in black robes walks by.
mobs.desc: You have never seen a person so drunk still walking!  With his bald head, he looks somewhat like a monk.  His robes are like those of a priest, but different in an undefinable way.  He grins at you sheepishly and takes another drink from his waterskin.

mobs.long_desc: The Seer stands here in a trance.
mobs.desc: This is a very pale and skinny little woman.  She awakes from her trance and points her finger to the sky, as if to warn you of some ominous danger. Whatever future she is seeing, it's not a pretty one...

mobs.long_desc: A woman dressed in heavy armor is going in the same direction as you.
mobs.desc: No-one messes with Derceta, and it is clear why: her crew cut, heavy armor and scarred, muscular body place her firmly within the club of experienced warriors.

mobs.long_desc: A one-armed druid nudges you.
mobs.desc: A long time ago, this druid lost his arm to the forces of evil.  He looks all the more angry for it.  His one arm is strong enough for two.

mobs.long_desc: A bat gets entangled in your hair!
mobs.desc: This bat is quite large, and unlike most bats, looks aggressive.  It also has long teeth, and it flies almost silently.

mobs.long_desc: A shepherd dozes off while leaning on his staff.
mobs.desc: It's not wholly clear what this shepherd druid is herding, exactly.  You peer around, but see no sheep, nowhere.  Anyway, he seems quite happy with his 'work'.  He smiles at you drowsily.

mobs.long_desc: A very old man is here gathering mistletoe.
mobs.desc: You see an ancient druid whose beard reaches to his waist and is plaited with twigs and leaves.  He seems quite worried as he examines the tree around him, muttering to himself.

mobs.long_desc: A creature with a face like a toad slogs through the swamp.
mobs.desc: Would YOU be happy if you had a face covered with warts?  With the head of a toad and the body of a man, this creature is uglier than any toad or man.  He seems all the more determined to take revenge for his ugliness on a handsome person like you!

mobs.keywords: large black winged adramalech demon adra figure
mobs.long_desc: A large, black, winged figure stands here, the ground charring beneath him.
mobs.desc: You look upon Adramalech, a mighty demon who has partially freed himself from the realms of Avernus.  His form shifts slightly but seems remarkably similar to that of a griffin.  He smiles slightly acknowledging your futile courage before he prepares to exterminate you.

mobs.long_desc: A lonely man walks up to you, glad to see a new face.
mobs.desc: Having avoided the company of humans for so long, this hermit seems to be a bit too shy to approach you.  He has an uncared-for appearance and can't quite keep his hands still.

mobs.long_desc: An old woman dressed in rags meets your eye.
mobs.desc: This haggard old woman lives from whatever she finds on the beach - which, by the look of it, is not much.  She glares at you from behind her greasy hair, like she expects some kind of action from you.

mobs.long_desc: A black butterfly flutters around your head.
mobs.desc: This large butterfly with black wings makes a death's-head moth look like a puny braggart!  It can deliver death in the utmost silence...

mobs.long_desc: A sailorman without a ship winks at you!
mobs.desc: This sailor is not above some mutiny or piracy now and then, but, in the absence of a ship, he is more than willing to rob you of your gold...

mobs.long_desc: Peekaboo! A wood dwarf looks at you between his fingers.
mobs.desc: This playful little man seems to be making fun of you!  Well, he's rather ugly himself, with that green skin of his.  He's wearing a green cap and green clothes.  Look, now he's pulling faces at you!

mobs.long_desc: A severed arm surges out of the water and grasps your ankle!
mobs.desc: This severed arm is possessed by the forces of the Dark.  It seems to be suspended between life and death, and it's trying hard to pull you over to the death-side.

mobs.long_desc: Awura the woodnymph floats by, totally ignoring you.
mobs.desc: Awura seems to glow with an inner light.  Her face is adorned by a cryptic smile, like she knows something you don't.  She is beautiful in an unreal way, looking like a figure from a dream.

mobs.long_desc: A rare Rotundifolia Carnivorica grows here!
mobs.desc: This carnivorous plant has leaves with teeth on the edges.  It lashes out at you, trying to pull you closer!

mobs.long_desc: A rabbit trips over its own paws!
mobs.desc: It looks like it's going mad!  It's jumping and flipping over backwards!  You notice white foam on its jaws...  Uh oh...  Mixomatosis?  Or maybe it ate one of those mushrooms?

mobs.long_desc: A leprous outcast is here, holding on to his outer extremities.
mobs.desc: He is a human man of indeterminate age.  His features are revolting, melting right off his skull!  His arms and legs are cankered and covered in sores, and his eyes plead with whomever they contact.

mobs.long_desc: Dagon, the gargantuan griffin god, roars at you!
mobs.desc: As you confront this monster, you feel an itty-bitty inadequate.  Just the fact that Dagon is about twice as big as the other griffins gives him the aura of a god.

mobs.long_desc: The mandragora man ogles at you.
mobs.desc: This man sets new standards for the concept 'face-fungus'.  His whole body, including his head, is covered with thick brown fur.  He looks at you with interest.

mobs.long_desc: A strongman with wild hair pats you on the head.
mobs.desc: You look at him enquiringly.  Delighted, he flexes his muscles at you.  He takes on more and more stances, trying hard to impress you.  Oh look, his face is as red as a tomato!

mobs.long_desc: You see a little woman with a hump.
mobs.desc: You peer at the kobold woman.  She's about as big as a newborn baby, and she's always making these little sounds to herself : 'Hu, hu hu, hu, hu, uh.  '

mobs.long_desc: A ferocious griffin swerves defiantly close to you.
mobs.desc: These are savage beasts, but in their savageness there is beauty.  When one sees the majesty with which these creatures move, one must avow that they are truly the rulers of the sky.  The griffin's eagle head and forelimbs look ready to rend any enemy in two, and their lion hindquarters are probably quite capable of mauling even much larger creatures.

mobs.long_desc: A ferocious griffin swerves defiantly close to you.
mobs.desc: These are savage beasts, but in their savageness there is beauty.  When one sees the majesty with which these creatures move, one must avow that they are truly the rulers of the sky.  The griffin's eagle head and forelimbs look ready to rend any enemy in two, and their lion hindquarters are probably quite capable of mauling even much larger creatures.

mobs.long_desc: A cute little griffin chick tries to lighten up your day!
mobs.desc: They're so small and cuddly!  They're so cute!  They mistake your fingers for fat juicy worms!

mobs.long_desc: A druid of the woods walks on air.
mobs.desc: A twig of mistletoe behind his ear expresses the druid's affinity with these woods.  He has the rugged looks of someone who has always lived outdoors, and has never felt the need to shave.  His feet tread on air!

mobs.long_desc: A druid of the woods walks by.
mobs.desc: A twig of mistletoe behind his ear expresses the druid's affinity with these woods.  He has the rugged looks of someone who has always lived outdoors, and has never felt the need to shave.

mobs.long_desc: A ferocious griffin is taking a nap here.
mobs.desc: These are savage beasts, but in their savageness there is beauty.  When one sees the majesty with which these creatures move, one must avow that they are truly the rulers of the sky.  The griffin's eagle head and forelimbs look ready to rend any enemy in two, and their lion hindquarters are probably quite capable of mauling even much larger creatures.  This one twitches in its sleep, fighting even in its dreams.

mobs.long_desc: A seagull screeches madly!
mobs.desc: You see before you a bird that once thought itself to be king of the sky, but that has learned to be humble since arriving on this island.

mobs.long_desc: A large griffin squats here glaring at you.
mobs.desc: This griffin looks very large and muscular.  Its wings seem a bit too small to lift the weight of its body, however its forepaws and claws look rather overdeveloped and it seems quite prepared to carry out any violence required to do its job.

mobs.long_desc: A large statue of a griffin stands here guarding the gate.
mobs.desc: It is an extremely lifelike statue, every feather is carved and it looks as though it could take off any second despite the fact that it is stone.

mobs.long_desc: The leader of the griffin cult glares at you coldly.
mobs.desc: You see a tall skinny man staring at you contemptously.  His face starts to twist into a sneer as he raises his hands to cast a spell.

mobs.long_desc: A large statue of a griffin stands here guarding the gate.
mobs.desc: It is an extremely lifelike statue, every feather is carved and it looks as though it could take off any second despite the fact that it is stone.

mobs.long_desc: A statue of a griffin stands here.
mobs.desc: It is an extremely lifelike statue, every feather is carved and it looks as though it could take off any second despite the fact that it is stone.

mobs.long_desc: A cult member is here praying to his evil god.
mobs.desc: He is a young man but he looks like he has not taken care of his appearance for a very long time. His beard is long and matted and his eyes are glazed as if he is hearing a voice inside his head. He moves like a zombie.

mobs.long_desc: A cult member is here praying to her evil god.
mobs.desc: She is quite young but very disheveled.  She seems almost to act without thinking, as if she has been brainwashed.

mobs.long_desc: A very large griffin stares intently at you.
mobs.desc: Skuran, the griffin captain, is about half as large again as any griffin you have seen so far.  He is watching you intently, waiting for you to make a move before he strikes and obliterates your puny body with his massive claws and beak.

mobs.long_desc: A small demon with feathered wings hops from foot to foot.
mobs.desc: This little imp-like demon resembles the half-eagle, half-beast nature of worldly griffins, but appears far more ferocious, despite its smaller size. It is very light on its feet, hopping from foot to foot, muscular wings stretched out behind it, flapping to keep it slightly aloft.  A razor-edged beak projects out of its ugly head, sitting right below two glowing red eyes.

mobs.long_desc: A young druidess floats around here, looking out around the grassland.
mobs.desc: She is young in age, but still looks tall enough to be an adult.  Her eyes sparkle with energy as she takes in the breathtaking view that is all around. She has a rugged look to her and it is obvious that she has lived outdoors for many years.

objects.ground: A gold-handled sickle lies here, shining.

extras.text: It is a small sickle made of shining gold.  Inscribed into the blade are the holy symbols of the druidic order, and the shape of the whole sickle is of course reminiscent of the crescent moon.  The golden sickle can be used as a weapon in a pinch, but its primary function is as a ritual instrument for the harvesting of mistletoe and other plants for ceremonial use.

objects.ground: A piece of thick, scarred leather lies on the floor.

extras.text: It is very hard and has an irregular form, just big enough to use as a breastplate.

objects.ground: A delicate crystal flower grows here.

extras.text: It's a crystalized dandelion.

objects.ground: A round shield with leather straps lies on the ground.

extras.text: This wooden shield has leather straps for easy holding.

objects.ground: A backpack of tough black leather has lost its owner.

extras.text: A vast amount of stuff can fit into this sturdy backpack.

objects.ground: A leather sack lies here in a puddle of water.

extras.text: A copper nozzle has been fitted to this leather watersack. It has a band of leather attached to it to make it easier to carry.

objects.short: a small key on a necklace
objects.ground: A small key on a necklace was lost here.

extras.text: It's a rather small key that will probably open a rather small door.

objects.ground: Someone has dropped a bent brass nail here.

extras.text: It looks like it was bent on purpose, perhaps to pry open a lock.

objects.ground: An iron key lies rusting here.

extras.text: It seems to be very old. Though rusted, it is not dirty and has been well cared for.

objects.ground: A handful of sneezing powder has been dropped on the ground here.

extras.text: You could make an elephant sneeze just by showing him this!

objects.ground: A shiny dentist utensil lies in the dust.

extras.text: It's a tiny hook like the one the dentaldruid uses to make you say 'AAAAAAaargh!'.

objects.ground: A ring of precious stone lies at your feet.

extras.text: It's a jade ring that once must have adorned the hand of a very special woman.

objects.ground: An iron hook sticks in the ground.

extras.text: It lies heavily in your hand.  Imagine smashing someone's head with this!

objects.ground: A sabre made for a giant has been planted in the floor.

extras.text: This is the two-handed scimitar of legend.  You appraisingly let its razor-sharp blade sweep through the air.  It was made by the best arms smith from the hardest steel.  It has only one purpose : to kill.

objects.ground: There is a circle of flowers on the ground.

extras.text: You smell the sweet perfume of these flowers.  They have not withered - this crown must have belonged to a very special person!

objects.ground: A delicate gown lies beneath your feet.

extras.text: The thin fabric of this silken robe offers better protection against the natural elements than it does against prying eyes... However, a pleasant warmth flows through you when you touch it.

objects.ground: A crystal midget stands here, his little cap radiating a clear white light.

extras.text: The crystal powers hold this little midget in their iron grasp!  The midget wiggles his little legs, but he cannot run away!

objects.ground: A pair of shoes with wings flutter around here!

extras.text: These starry blue shoes seem to be alive!  They have wings attached to them and make little loopings when they know you're looking at them.

objects.ground: A black leather skirt reinforced with chain armor lies on the floor.

extras.text: Hundreds of small iron rings have been attached to this black leather skirt. A shark could break its teeth on it!

objects.ground: There's a quicksilver bracelet on the ground, continually changing its shape.

extras.text: Continually changing its shape, it gives the impression of being alive!

objects.ground: A pair of heavy-duty leather gloves has dropped out of someone's back pocket.

extras.text: These are meant for heavy-duty work!

objects.ground: A whipping post draws your attention.

extras.text: It's a rather small wooden beam with an iron ring at its end, meant to chain people to.

objects.ground: An herb with an acrid smell grows here.

extras.text: The only thing differentiating it from the other herbs is that it smells absolutely foul.

objects.ground: A full-grown mushroom stands in the shade.

extras.text: It's blue and looks quite inedible.

objects.ground: A mussel has chosen this place for a home.

extras.text: Yummy! A raw, living mussel... what a delicacy!

objects.ground: The golden-brown tail of a griffin lies here seperated from its owner.

extras.text: It's long and rather strong, too.  Maybe you could use it as a belt...

objects.ground: A pair of baggy green pants have left their owner in the nude.

extras.text: It's an outmoded model that will make you the laughingstock of the town!

objects.ground: A crystal amulet has scorched the ground!

extras.text: It causes a light burn wound when you touch it for too long.

objects.ground: You nearly trip over a piece of flintstone.

extras.text: It's a primitive axe, made with primitive tools by someone rather primitive.

objects.ground: A sword with strange signs on its blade is the focus of your attention.

extras.text: The runes on its blade give this sword its magical power.

objects.ground: An oakwood staff lies here abandoned.

extras.text: A typical druid's staff, it has multiple uses.  It can be wielded as a weapon or just used as a walking cane, and comes in handy...  Always!

objects.ground: The head of a griffin lies on the ground.

extras.text: This cloak made from the head of a griffin completely covers the face of the person that wears it.  It is obviously used in some dark ritual.

objects.ground: There's a horn lying in front of you.

extras.text: Once used by a man with powerful lungs, it will never again make a sound.  A big rock is firmly stuck inside.

objects.ground: There's a wooden sheath on the floor.

extras.text: It is meant to contain a sword, but it looks like you could use it armor yourself a bit more, too.

objects.ground: A bottle lies on the ground.

extras.text: This is a very small bottle, made of dark green glass. It's ice-cold to the touch.

objects.ground: A scrap of paper blows in the wind.

extras.text: It has rune letters written upon it.

objects.ground: There's a lever here.

extras.text: It's a rather large lever made of hard wood.

objects.ground: A small branch from an oak tree lies here.

extras.text: This is no ordinary branch, it feels warm to the touch and you can only surmise that it has come from one of the druid's fabled holy oaks.

objects.ground: A large red book lies here looking interesting.

extras.text: The cover says 'A basic history of Griffin Island' The chapter headings are: chapter1 : The griffin cult chapter2 : Earle chapter3 : The future

This chapter is entitled 'The Cult of the Griffin' and it reads: From time immemorable griffins have lived on this island, and also those who revere them as powerful, supernatural creatures. The cult believe that Dagon is the god of the griffins and chooses one griffin captain to lead the other griffins during their time on the island.  The strength of the griffins is dependant on their captain, if he dies then the power and influence of the griffins wanes until a new captain is appointed by Dagon.  The cult also believe that if they can summon Dagon to appear in mortal form, as the ultimate griffin captain he will bring ultimate power to the griffins and hence their worshippers.  The cult worship in a chapel which contains an altar that Dagon has invested with the power to generate new griffins.  In olden times the chamber containing the altar was linked via a large crystal to the surface where it drew power from the sun.

Earle As long as there have been griffins on this island there have also been druids, and as long as there have been druids, there has been Earle, the eldest druid. Earle defeated the last griffin captain who was named Arkranos and at the same time broke the megalith which was the conduit for the power required by the altar. He never actually destroyed the altar though, and so the griffins continue to thrive and there is now a rumour that a new captain has been appointed. There is a rumour that when Earle started to fight Arkranos he realised that he would need assistance to completely remove the threat of griffins from the island because the holy oak there had been contaminated with the evil. Stories tell of a weapon that was fashioned to kill Dagon and that the unthinkable occurred when a cutting was taken from a holy oak to help restore balance on the isle. The items were sent but never received.

The future The seer has prophesied that the cult will finally discover the means to allow Dagon to appear in mortal form, and that at this point they shall understand his true nature and be destroyed.

objects.ground: A thin black book lies on the floor here.

extras.text: It seems to be a diary of some sort, although there are no dates written in it. Someone has written down thoughts as they occurred, mainly on the true essence of the griffins and their god Dagon. On the back page there seem to be some quotes from other books with a final line:

objects.ground: A badly cracked crystalline monument stands upright here.

extras.text: Reaching up to the heavens, this huge crystal must have been created by a highly skilled artisan.  It's purose is hard to discern, and wild thoughts and rumors fill your head as your mind fills with images of ancient druids and battles, and the mythical beasts of lore.

objects.ground: A coiled rope ladder shifts slightly on the floor.
A clear bottle of some amber liquid is standing here.
An intricately carved granite altar stands here.

extras.text: The altar is decorated with intricate designs that depict human-like beings with high foreheads, and griffins that breathe fire.  The surface of the altar contains several grooves and holes which seem to contain mainly large feathers.

objects.ground: Two halves of a granite altar stand here.

extras.text: The intricate granite altar lies in two jagged pieces with a small oak sapling growing in the rubble.

objects.ground: A small oak sapling grows here.

extras.text: The sapling glows slightly and its leaves rustle constantly. The roots almost seem to be twitching while you watch.

objects.ground: There is a wooden crate in the corner of the room.
A small pool of water lies at the bottom of the well.

extras.text: Although this pool only seems shallow, you realise that you can't actually see the bottom of the well through it.  Very strange.

objects.ground: A dark patch seems to indicate a small tear in the demonic plane.

extras.text: Perhaps this is how Dagon escaped this realm?

objects.ground: A beautiful wooden helmet lies here gleaming slightly.

extras.text: Crafted from the finest wood, this helmet is both sturdy and comfortable.  It sits softer on the head than a metal helm, and provides extra insulation against the elements.  Intricate green artwork decorates its outer surface, depicting leaves and trees.

objects.ground: A completely smooth black mask lies on the floor, shimmering slightly.

extras.text: The mask is smooth to the touch, yet no highlights are visible on its surface. Its color is that of the deepest black.  Expressionless ovals allow its wearer to see, and small openings assist with breathing, but no other feature is visible.  Indeed, it appears to float in front of its wearer's face with no means of support.

objects.short: a necklace made of woven leaves
objects.ground: A necklace made of woven leaves lies forgotten here.

extras.text: This necklace was very intricately made.  It is made of several small green leaves woven together to form a very pretty necklace.

objects.ground: A large dead clam floats in the water here.
A small pear shaped pearl lies forgotten here.

extras.text: This pearl is like no other you have seen before.  Instead of being a circular shape like most pearls are this pearl is in the shape of a pear.  It is also quite a bit larger than most pearls too.

objects.ground: A crisp little scroll with mirrored lettering has rolled into a corner.

triggers.name: boulder_move
triggers.commands: wecho The boulder slowly starts to move back. wdoor 49042 s room 49084 wdoor 49084 n purge wdoor 49084 n room 49042 wait 8 s wecho The boulder seems to be rolling slowly backward - better hurry! wait 5 s wecho The boulder rolls back and seals the entrance. wdoor 49042 s purge wdoor 49084 n flags abcd wdoor 49084 n key 49036 wdoor 49084 n description The boulder seems to have been loosened. wdoor 49084 n name boulder

triggers.name: test_remote_world
triggers.commands: opurge sheath

triggers.name: drop_sapling
triggers.commands: * The sapling is dropped. If Dagon is present, it will grow and destroy * the altar, weakening him. if %object.vnum% == 49045 && %self.people[49021]% wait 1 s wecho The sapling vibrates faster and faster and its roots start to grow! wecho Even as you watch, the sapling moves towards the altar and starts to grow into it. wpurge sapling wpurge griffin-altar wload obj 49044 wait 1 s wecho CRACK! wait 1 s wecho The altar has been broken by the sapling! wforce dagon emote shrieks in rage and pain as the source of his power is destroyed. wforce dagon dagonisweaknow end

triggers.name: dagon_is_weakened
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == %self.vnum% set dagonisweak 1 global dagonisweak else return 0 endif

triggers.name: dagon_in_combat
triggers.commands: if %dagonisweak% != 1 m_run_room_trig 49005 end

triggers.name: dagon_gets_healed
triggers.commands: wheal dagon 2000

triggers.name: death_of_dagon
triggers.commands: return 0 mecho Dagon utters a blood curdling scream as his demonic spirit returns to its realm. m_run_room_trig 49007 if !(%get.mob_count[49010]%) mat 49190 mload mob 49010 mat 49190 mforce adramalech mload obj 49034 endif

triggers.name: dagon_death_pt2
triggers.commands: set person %self.people% while %person% if %person.quest_stage[griffin_quest]% == 6 quest advance griffin_quest %person.name% wsend %person% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 wsend %person% &7&bProof of the deed must be delivered individually.&0 endif set person %person.next_in_room% done

triggers.name: adramalech_dies
triggers.commands: return 0 mecho %self.name% emits a bone-rattling roar that fades away into a low rattle. mecho %self.name% disintegrates into darkly glowing spots that fade from view. if %self.room% != 49190 mteleport all 49190 mecho &0 mecho &7&bA rift opens in the fabric of reality and pulls you through!&0 mecho &0 set room %get.room[49190]% set person %room.people% while %person% if %person.vnum% == -1 mforce %person% look set person %person.next_in_room% endif done endif unset person set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% set stage 8 if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %person.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[griffin_quest]% == %stage% quest advance griffin_quest %person.name% endif elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done mat 49190 m_run_room_trig 49009

triggers.name: Griffin Island Quest exp rewards
triggers.commands: wait 1 set person %self.people% set stage 9 while %person% if %person.quest_stage[griffin_quest]% == %stage% * * Set X to the level of the award - code does not run without it *  Griffin Isle, X = 60 if %person.level% < 60 set expcap %person.level% else set expcap 60 endif set expmod 0 if %expcap% < 9 eval expmod (((%expcap% * %expcap%) + %expcap%) / 2) * 55 elseif %expcap% < 17 eval expmod 440 + ((%expcap% - 8) * 125) elseif %expcap% < 25 eval expmod 1440 + ((%expcap% - 16) * 175) elseif %expcap% < 34 eval expmod 2840 + ((%expcap% - 24) * 225) elseif %expcap% < 49 eval expmod 4640 + ((%expcap% - 32) * 250) elseif %expcap% < 90 eval expmod 8640 + ((%expcap% - 48) * 300) else eval expmod 20940 + ((%expcap% - 89) * 600) endif * * Adjust exp award by class so all classes receive the same proportionate amount * switch %person.class% case Warrior case Berserker * * 110% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% / 10)) break case Paladin case Anti-Paladin case Ranger * * 115% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + ((%expmod% * 2) / 15)) break case Sorcerer case Pyromancer case Cryomancer case Illusionist case Bard * * 120% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% / 5)) break case Necromancer case Monk * * 130% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% * 2) / 5) break default set expmod %expmod% done wsend %person% &3&bYou gain experience!&0 eval setexp (%expmod% * 10) set loop 0 while %loop% < 10 * * Xexp must be replaced by mexp, oexp, or wexp for this code to work * Pick depending on what is running the trigger * Griffin Isle, xexp = wexp wexp %person% %setexp% eval loop %loop% + 1 done set gem 0 while %gem% < 3 eval drop %random.11% + 55736 wload obj %drop% eval gem %gem% + 1 wforce %person% get gem done quest complete griffin_quest %person.name% endif set person %person.next_in_room% done

triggers.name: rope_ladder
triggers.commands: if %object.vnum% == 49041 wait 1 s wecho The ladder unrolls and forms a rigid structure down the cliff. wdoor 49149 d room 49028 wdoor 49028 u room 49149 wpurge rope-ladder endif

triggers.name: whisky_trig
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %object.type% == LIQ CONTAINER if %object.val1% == 0 say An empty container?  How generous. elseif %object.val2% != 5 say Whisky is what I wanted! else say Thanks %actor.name% and here is your ladder mload obj 49041 give ladder %actor.name% endif endif

triggers.name: reroll_ladder

triggers.name: UNUSED

I nearly forgot.  This belongs to you, if you can mecho &0bear to touch it.' give griffin-skin %actor.name% wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'If you can't bear to use it, give it to Awura who will mecho &0destroy it.  Maybe she will give you something more to your taste.' elseif %object.vnum% == 49042 return 1 wait 8 emote looks rather surprised. wait 2s say Well now, you found it!  How very resourceful of you! wait 2s emote peers suspiciously into %object.shortdesc%. wait 2s if %object.val1% != 16 glare %actor.name% wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'Well you had to help yourself, now, didn't you! mecho &0You have no idea how thirs*HIC* I am! I'm not drinking that! glare %actor.name wait 2s drop clear-glass-bottle else emote smiles and takes a healthy swig from %object.shortdesc%. wait 2s say Thank you, %actor.name%. triggers.name: Earle receive branch
triggers.commands: * Small oak branch given wait 2 set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %person.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[griffin_quest]% == 0 quest start griffin_quest %person.name% msend %person% &7&bYou have now begun the Griffin Isle quest!&0 endif quest variable griffin_quest %person% oak 1 elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done mjunk small-oak-branch if !%get.mob_count[49001]% mat 49081 mload mob 49001 endif mat 49081 mforce undead-captain mload obj 49037 say Ah, excellent work, %actor.name%. emote examines the oak branch. wait 2 s say The centuries have taken their toll, but it is still powerful. emote utters some incantations and the branch starts to sprout roots and leaves! mload obj 49045 give sapling %actor.name% wait 3 s say This sapling needs to be placed near the altar to be effective.  May the tree spirits guard you. if %actor.quest_stage[griffin_quest]% == 1 wait 2 s say Now, did you also retrieve the sword?  Give it to me. endif

triggers.name: crowley_speak1
triggers.commands: wait 4 mecho %self.name% says, 'I drink to forget until I forget to drink.  The chapel mecho &0was the most horrible place I have ever seen.  The sight of it is burned into mecho &0my mind.' wait 2 s msend %actor.name% %self.name% falls to the ground before you. mechoaround %actor.name% %self.name% falls to the ground before %actor.name%. say I beg you to destroy that place utterly. wait 3 s mecho %self.name% stands and dusts off his clothes. say May the tree spirits guard you.

triggers.name: crowley_speak2
triggers.commands: wait 2 mmobflag %self% sentinel on if %actor.quest_stage[griffin_quest]% < 3 say Oh, does she now?  Are you certain? peer %actor.name% elseif %actor.vnum% == -1 say Oh, I had hoped this would never happen. hiccup wait 4 mecho %self.name% says, 'I suppose she told you that I know where the cult's chapel is?' sigh wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'I rolled a boulder over the entrance and persuaded Derceta to guard it.  I used to be quite strong in my youth.' strut wait 2s say But drink has done away with that. wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'In fact, the only person who I can think of who could possibly move it would be Derceta.  I suggest you ask her to help move the boulder.' wait 3s emote takes a swig from his waterskin. say Ah, the drink helps me forget, but not for long. endif mmobflag %self% sentinel off

triggers.name: seer_speak1
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %self.room% != 49078 say I am powerless to help you outside my cave. else switch %actor.quest_stage[griffin_quest]% case 0 mecho %self.name% says, 'You say Earle sent you?  Hmm, he may have done, but there is nothing I can do for you.' break case 1 mecho %self.name% says, 'Did you give the rune sword to Earle yet?  He has to verify that you can go through with this.' break default mecho %self.name% says, 'Ah... my vision is coming true.  The cult grows in strength and will soon be strong enough to summon Dagon, the powerful griffin god.' wait 3 s mecho %self.name% says, 'Seek ye that drunken lout, for he has found the path to the chapel.  Say to him, &7&b'the seer requests your assistance'&0 and he will tell you what he knows.' emote closers her eyes and goes into a trance. wait 3 s emote wails with fear. mecho %self.name% says, 'I see the future, when an evil greater than Dagon will walk the island.' emote opens her eyes again. wait 2 s sigh say There is much to do, and little time to do it. done set person %actor% set stage 2 set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %person.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[griffin_quest]% == %stage% quest advance griffin_quest %person.name% msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 endif elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done endif

triggers.name: Bash_door
triggers.commands: return 0

rooms.name: Stone Arch
rooms.description: Created by thousands of years of erosion, this solid arch of stone spans the distance from the mainland to Griffin Isle.  Far below the sea violently bashes the ancient rocks.  The air smells of the ocean, and there is no respite from unyielding forces of nature.

South.description: A stone arch leading to the island.

rooms.name: Stone Arch
rooms.description: A skilled mason's hands have made this part of the stone arch more easily scalable by carving steps into the rock.  To the south the ground becomes even more hospitable as the stone arch meets the island.  The climb to the north is steep though, and the miserable excuse for a path leading down tries hard to look even tougher.

North.description: A stone arch, connecting the mainland with the island.

Down.description: Lots of very sharp and deadly looking rocks...

rooms.name: On the island
rooms.description: Dotted with small and round patches of tall grass, this stretch of sandstone may well be called the entrance to Griffin Isle.  The cold, hard stone arch to the north serves as a welcome, and offers little comfort.  Farther to the south the island opens, in all its splendor.

North.description: A stone arch leading to the mainland.

South.description: The beginning of the northern path.

rooms.name: Northern Path
rooms.description: Trees and shrubs in all shades of green line the path that starts here and leads to the west.  To the north you can just make out the island's connection with the mainland.

rooms.name: Crossroads
rooms.description: Though the rocky path going north and the broad, neatly trimmed lawn leading south do not exactly join up, this can be called a crossroads of sorts.  The northern path continues to the west.  A considerate creature has placed a signpost here.

extras.text: Four wooden arrows point you in the right direction : /\ The Beach < The Megalyth                       Stone Arch > The Village \/

rooms.name: Northern Path
rooms.description: You are on a long stretch of path running from east to west.  A sweet breeze carries flowery scents to your nose.  To the south, the dense forest forms a natural fence to the druids' woods, while a stretch of rather unfriendly looking rocks blocks your way to the north.  A long stretch of path, covered with small pebbles, runs from east to west.

rooms.name: Northern Path
rooms.description: Some strange force has caused the vegetation here to grow strangely.  All plantlife seems to stretch itself to catch as much of the blue glow as they possibly can.  Here and there flowers have grown to a grotesque shape.  The path seems to lead right into the light to the west.  To the east the world becomes normal again.

rooms.name: Crystal Megalith
rooms.description: Like a broken bone sticking out of a wound, this tree-high crystal spire interrupts the northern path.  An aura of evil surrounds this vile structure. The area surrounding the monument is emerald green, well-manicured grass. Many exotic flowers flourish here, and the sweet smells are intoxicating.

rooms.name: Mudflats
rooms.description: Here, on these mudflats, land and sea are in perfect balance.  In the light emanating from the crystalline monument, you notice the glistening of salt on the many patches of sand not flooded by the water.  Aquatic creatures of all shapes and sizes, interact with land animals in the delicate dance of living.

rooms.name: Sandy Beach
rooms.description: This beautiful beach is made of fine sand, and is dotted with crushed and small shells.  The sea gently, repeatedly, kisses the earth as the two meet. From here the beach continues to the east.

rooms.name: Sandy Beach
rooms.description: This beautiful beach is made of fine sand, and is dotted with crushed and small shells.  Waves lazily slosh onto the sand, bringing long strings of black seaweed with them.  Large boulders of yellow stone prohibit passage to the inland parts of the island

rooms.name: Boathouse
rooms.description: Years of weathering have given this wooden boat house a gray and mildewed appearance.  The wood has rotted out in some places, the shutters barely hang to the frames, and the glass that was once in the windows has been removed or broken.  The door to the house has rotted off of it's hinges, nothing is left to deter theives from making off with whatever is inside.

Up.description: You can clamber onto the roof.

rooms.name: Slope
rooms.description: Erosion from heavy rains over countless years have carved a natural channel here.  Rubble and rocks lie loosely against the incline rising eastward, and it looks like even the slightest disturbance might start an avalanche.

rooms.name: Pebbles Beach
rooms.description: To the west the cliffs start their steep ascent again, while to the south the beach continues.  There seems to be a trail heading towards the cliff.

rooms.name: Circle Of Stone
rooms.description: Approach with respect - this is consecrated ground.  These monolithic stones were placed here thousands of years ago, in the exact configuration they are still in now.  As you near, you can almost feel the incredible cosmic energies they have gathered in their time.

rooms.name: Pebbles Beach
rooms.description: Lots of smooth little pebbles of various shapes, sizes, and colors, make this colorful quiet beach.  The ocean, from this point, seems to stretch out to eternity.  Inland the scenery becomes somewhat more green from the abundance of flora.

rooms.name: Western Beach
rooms.description: Pieces of wreckage, blown onto the island by a strong stormwind, litter the beach.  Rotting hulls and planks from wrecks, huge masts snapped like twigs, and an occasional downed tree make this beach seem like a graveyard.  The shoreline continues to the south

rooms.name: Marsh
rooms.description: The nutrient rich silt and mud that makes up the primordial mixture of this marsh brims over with new life.  The reeds in this swamp have grown to a considerable height, making it impossible to see very far.

rooms.name: Right Eye Lake
rooms.description: This is a tranquil lake of cool water that is bordered by trees.  Its surface is only occasionally disturbed by those fish who can be bothered to take a look a you.

rooms.name: Underneath The Arch
rooms.description: Slipping and sliding, you daringly scramble down an impossible slope, only to be soaked to the bone by a wall of water whipped up by the wind!  Only a few black stones covered with seaweed may possibly provide unsure footing amidst the restless water, that pounds the rocks incessently.

rooms.name: Right Eye Lake
rooms.description: This is a tranquil lake of cool water that is bordered by trees.  Its surface is only occasionally disturbed by those fish who can be bothered to take a look at you.

rooms.name: Eliah's Tree
rooms.description: Eliah's house is placed high in this oak tree, giving him a great view of the Lake and the northern part of the island - well, in autumn and winter at least.  There is a spiral staircase wrapped around the stem of the tree, just in case there's a visitor who doesn't feel like flying.  The 'village' continues to the east and to the south.

rooms.name: Entrance To The Druids' Woods
rooms.description: The entrance to the druid's village and the village itself is awe inspiring. Where you would expect paved roads, there is a soft lawn; instead of stone houses, you see massive 100 year old trees holding tree-houses in their branches.  To the east is Left Eye Lake.  Flowers grow to the west and to the south.

rooms.name: Left Eye Lake
rooms.description: Here, far from the shore, your mind has a chance to settle down.  Only the fish will disturb you here.  The sound of the surf can be heard, as well as the cheerful sounds of wildlife.

rooms.name: In The Well
rooms.description: The well is dry and the walls and floor are completely smooth.  They seem to have been smoothed by some magical means as there is not a chip or any sign of a tool.  You feel a sense of impending doom as you loiter here.  Something very powerful has created this.

rooms.name: Left Eye Lake
rooms.description: The breeze gently ripples the water, distorting the reflections in the lake. Here far from the shore, your mind has a chance to settle down.  Only the fish will disturb you here.

rooms.name: Grassland
rooms.description: Stretched out for as far as the eye can see is a large, emerald green sea of grass.  The soft ground would be perfect for napping on a warm spring day. From here the vast expanse of the ocean can be fully taken in.  The smells and sights are almost intoxicating.

rooms.name: Broken Bones Path
rooms.description: The ground crunches beneath you feet.  What must be hundreds of crushed bones, bleached out white from the sun and salt-air, make up this path.  Going south seems barely possible.

rooms.name: The Wreck Of The 'St Marvin'
rooms.description: Here lies the wreck of the 'St.  Marvin'.  Not much is left of this once proud merchant vessel - where the keel used to be, there is now a large gaping wound.  It's infamous canons probably rest on the bottom of the sea.  To the east and above you is an overhanging cliff.

rooms.name: Marsh
rooms.description: The nutrient rich silt and mud that makes up the primordial mixture of this marsh brims over with new life.  The reeds in this swamp have grown to a considerable height, making it impossible to see very far.

rooms.name: Right Eye Lake
rooms.description: This is a tranquil lake of cool water that is bordered by trees.  Its surface is only occasionally disturbed by those fish who can be bothered to take a look at you.

rooms.name: Holy Oak
rooms.description: Towering over the surrounding oak trees at well over 100 feet, this tree looks like it has lived a millenium, perhaps more.  It's trunk is huge, maybe 50 or 60 feet in diameter.  The branches extend from the tree creating a huge shadow that one could easily build a large home under.  It is truly a marvel of nature, and of the talent of the druids who tend to the forest here.

Down.description: Several of the roots look rather strange, perhaps even fake.

rooms.name: Five Birches
rooms.description: The five heavy birches that grow here in a cluster, support a tree-house unlike all the others.  The treehouse far above is almost the size of a typical human dwelling.  A small rope ladder allows access to the tree house itself.

rooms.name: Suspended House
rooms.description: Built around the tree trunk, this circular house creaks as it is gently rocked by the wind.  Arm-thick ropes swung around the pine-tree's branches keep the house suspended just above your head.

rooms.name: Left Eye Lake
rooms.description: Thick mist prevents you from seeing exactly where you are, but the fact that your feet are getting wet tells you enough.  Through shards of mist, standing stones can be seen to the east.

rooms.name: Mushroom Patch
rooms.description: Psilocybe Cubensis grows affluently on this knoll overlooking Left Eye Lake. These sky-blue mushrooms are used by the druids in their explorations of the higher regions of consciousness, it is rumored that they are also the main ingredient of several magical elixirs, including potions of fly.

rooms.name: Grassland
rooms.description: Stretched out for as far as the eye can see is a large, emerald green sea of grass.  The soft ground would be perfect for napping on a warm spring day. From here the vast expanse of the ocean can be fully taken in.  The smells and sights are almost intoxicating.

rooms.name: Broken Bones Path
rooms.description: The ground crunches beneath you feet.  What must be hundreds of crushed bones, bleached out white from the sun and salt-air, make up this path.  Going south seems barely possible.

rooms.name: Seaside Hills
rooms.description: Soft rolling hills covered with grass and clover, and thistles, dandelions, poppies, and oxeye daisies are far too numerous to count.  The urge to nap is almost overwhelming.  To the west, the sea lies far below.

rooms.name: Marsh
rooms.description: The nutrient rich silt and mud that makes up the primordial mixture of this marsh brims over with new life.  The reeds in this swamp have grown to a considerable height, making it impossible to see very far.

rooms.name: Edge Of The Woods
rooms.description: The ground raises itself out of the swamp and becomes firm and dry.  You are on the edge of a forest.  Northeast of here, a light is sometimes visible between the trees.

rooms.name: Living Treehouse
rooms.description: This must be the most wonderful of tree houses!  The branches of this tree form a floor and walls, its dense crown a roof of leaves.  The tree seems to embrace its inhabitants, like it actually cares for the people it holds.

rooms.name: Derceta's Tree
rooms.description: This is where Derceta, the wandering warrior-druid, has made her temporary home.  It is a small undistinguished tree compared to some of the others in this forest.  Derceta obviously did not spend much time tending to it, preferring to practice her fighting skills.  To the south of the tree is a small hillock with a boulder on the near side of it.

extras.text: It could probably be moved - by a very strong person!

rooms.name: Clearing
rooms.description: This doesn't look like a construction site, but it is!  In the middle of this large open space a baby-tree is fighting its way towards the sky. Strange rune signs drawn on the ground protect the would-be druid's house against evil influences.

rooms.name: Hollow Wood Giant
rooms.description: Always looking for ways to live in closer communion with Nature, the druids have hollowed out this giant tree, apparently without harming it.  The trunk has the dimensions of a castle tower.  An opening that is probably the front door is just above your head.

rooms.name: Herb Garden
rooms.description: Herbs and spices from all over the world have been planted here in tidy rows.  Some are familiar to you, some unknown.  The result is a mix of aromas that immediately stirs up strange emotions deep inside of you.

rooms.name: Grassland
rooms.description: Stretched out for as far as the eye can see is a large, emerald green sea of grass.  The soft ground would be perfect for napping on a warm spring day. From here the vast expanse of the ocean can be fully taken in.  The smells and sights are almost intoxicating.

rooms.name: Mussel Bank
rooms.description: Thousands of mussels truly crowd the shore here, more than a few as large as the palm of your hand.  Talk about favorable natural conditions!  Seafood afficionados can enjoy it to their heart's content...

rooms.name: Seaside Hills
rooms.description: Soft rolling hills covered with grass and clover, and thistles, dandelions, poppies, and oxeye daisies are far too numerous to count.  The urge to nap is almost overwhelming.  To the west, the sea lies far below.

rooms.name: Inside The House
rooms.description: Draught comes through a crack in the door, but the fireplace manages to warm your chilly bones.  A few sticks of furniture fill the room.  It looks like Mr. Crowley is somewhat of a beachcomber in his spare time.  Only the engraved plaque on the wall stands out from the rest.

extras.text: It reads: " 'Tis an ill wind that blows no minds " - Malaclypse The Younger

rooms.name: Brother Crowley's House
rooms.description: Sheltered in a dip between the hills, this is a simple house for an austere man.  It's made of stone with a door big enough to pull a boat through, and a single small window.  A sign above the door reads 'Thelema'.  Smoke twirls out of the chimney.

West.description: There's a shutter in front of the window.

Up.description: You can clamber onto the roof of the house if you want.

extras.text: There's a shutter in front of the window.
It looks like it's out of use.

rooms.name: Well
rooms.description: Strangely enough, the brickwork around this well is rather low.  A wooden cover keeps animals and people from falling into it.  There's a strange symbol on the cover.  There is the faint smell of sulphur in the air.

extras.text: It has a heavy iron lock on it, but perhaps it could be levered off the well.
This lock looks like it has rusted shut, you will never get this off.
There is a horned triangle carved into the cover.

rooms.name: Sunken Road
rooms.description: Trees that bend over to obscure the sky line this path.  Shadowy figures hide in the thorn-bushes, waiting to catch you unawares.  The road continues east- and westward.

rooms.name: Sunken road
rooms.description: Trees that bend over to obscure the sky line this path.  Shadowy figures hide in the thorn-bushes, waiting to catch you unawares.  The road continues east- and westward.

rooms.name: Dirt Path
rooms.description: A twisting little path that leads to all kinds of opportunities east and west of here.

rooms.name: Crater
rooms.description: You step down into a deep crater, obviously formed not long ago.  Debris from whatever hit the ground here lies scattered all around.  The earth around the crater has been scorched by the tremendous impact.  You can see possible exits to the west and to the north.

rooms.name: Grassland
rooms.description: A lazy meadow with a view of the sea, this is the perfect grazing ground for cattle.

rooms.name: Hanging Rock
rooms.description: Imagine a ten thousand ton monolith hovering just above your head.  Now, quickly, before it drops and crushes you to ketchup, imagine that this monolith is attached at the top to an even larger one standing next to it, so that it won't drop.  Good.  You can relax now.

rooms.name: Rocky Beach
rooms.description: The beach ends against a cliff to the south, although there seems to be a small entrance in the base of the cliff.  To the north the shoreline continues while to the west is the main body of the island.

rooms.name: Cave-In
rooms.description: Just a few footsteps in front of you, the island ends abruptly in a steep cliff.  Part of the island has been savagely torn off by the sea.

rooms.name: Dead Forest
rooms.description: Gnarled, shapeless trees, and grass that crumbles to dust under one's boots...  Death has a stranglehold on this forest.

rooms.name: Dead Forest
rooms.description: Gnarled.  Shapeless trees, and grass that crumbles to dust under one's boots...  Death has a stranglehold on this forest.

rooms.name: Dead Forest
rooms.description: Gnarled, shapeless trees, and grass that crumbles to dust under one's boots...  Death has a stranglehold on this forest.

rooms.name: Dead Forest
rooms.description: Gnarled, shapeless trees, and grass that crumbles to dust under one's boots...  Death has a stranglehold on this forest.

rooms.name: Dead Forest
rooms.description: Gnarled, shapeless trees, and grass that crumbles to dust under one's boots...  Death has a stranglehold on this forest.

rooms.name: Ancient Monument
rooms.description: A gigantic statue extracted from the volcanic stone stands on a stone pedestal, making it visible from afar.  The stone colossus depicts a face with a long, straight nose, a narrow lipped mouth, sunken eyes and a low forehead.

rooms.name: Beacon Fire
rooms.description: Pirates have made a large fire here, trying to lure ships onto the treacherous cliffs.  The flames prey eagerly on the dry wood from the dead forest.

rooms.name: Dead Man's Dive
rooms.description: This is THE place for a quick exit to Nirvana Terminal.  The razor-edged rocks at the base of this cliff will make sure that the sharks get their meat in nice, bite-size chunks...

rooms.name: Top Of The Bay
rooms.description: A mist of fine water droplets covers your face.  Just a few steps to the south, and a long way down, the waves crash violently into the island.  You decide that a speedy death is not what you are after.

rooms.name: Griffin Ground
rooms.description: This is griffin territory, here the mythical beasts reign supreme, here they are king of all they survey.  Whoever dares to tread here becomes vulnerable to their most vicious attacks.

rooms.name: Hollow
rooms.description: The griffins have made their nests in this dried up swamp, out of the wind. Animal skeletons bleached in the sun lie here and there.

rooms.name: Hollow
rooms.description: The griffins have made their nests in this dried up swamp, out of the wind. Animal skeletons bleached in the sun lie here and there.

rooms.name: Griffin Ground
rooms.description: This is griffin territory, here the mythical beasts reign supreme, here they are king of all they survey.  Whoever dares to tread here becomes vulnerable to their most vicious attacks.

rooms.name: Black Cliff
rooms.description: The sea has failed to dent this unyielding cliff of hard volcanic stone. It stands apart from the white cliffs to the east, like a rotten tooth in a grinning mouth.

rooms.name: White Cliffs
rooms.description: It is said that on a good day one can see these white marble cliffs from the other side of the sea, gleaming in the sunlight.  But then, only adventurers of the worst sort over return from the other side of the sea.  A southern gale makes it impossible to breathe normally.  Somehow, this unforgiving environment seems to suit the ferocious griffins.

rooms.name: White Cliffs
rooms.description: It is said that on a good day one can see these white marble cliffs from the other side of the sea, gleaming in the sunlight.  But then, only adventurers of the worst sort ever return from the other side of the sea.  A southern gale makes it impossible to breathe normally.  Somehow, this unforgiving environment seems to suit the ferocious griffins.

rooms.name: White Cliffs
rooms.description: It is said that on a good day one can see these white marble cliffs from the other side of the sea, gleaming in the sunlight.  But then, only adventurers of the worst sort ever return from the other side of the sea.  A southern gale makes it impossible to breathe normally.  Somehow, this unforgiving environment seems to suit the ferocious griffins.

rooms.name: Panorama Point
rooms.description: Higher than all the other hills, Panorama Point provides the best overview of the island.  Through thick shards of mist, you can just barely recognize the island's skull shape.

rooms.name: Seer's Cave
rooms.description: This cave is very bare, with a large pool of rainwater in one corner and some phosphorescent moss coating the walls.  There seems to be no furniture or anything resembling a creature comfort.  The seer obviously takes her calling very seriously.

rooms.name: Sentinel Rock
rooms.description: Sentinel Rock rises out of the foaming waters, a solitary rock that will not yield to the sea's undying pressure.

rooms.name: Between The Roots Of The Holy Tree
rooms.description: You have to stoop down to get into the cavity underneath the tree. Surprisingly enough this hollow is rather large- it's a little house!  There's a tiny little bench here, and a little table...  Everything here is made to the size of little people.

Up.description: The roots up above open to the outside.

rooms.name: Inside The 'St. Marvin'
rooms.description: The sound of water dripping echoes through the hull, which is filled knee-deep with mucky water.  A foul stench hits your nostrils.

rooms.name: Claustrophobic Passage
rooms.description: It's too dark to see; too narrow to breathe.  An oozing slime attaches itself to your clothes, your face...  It gets in your mouth...  YUCK!!  An iron gate with bars as thick as your arms blocks the way to the south.

South.description: There's a sturdy iron gate to the south.

rooms.name: MOBILE_TRANSFER_ROOM
rooms.description: Hmm...  You shouldn't be in here!  Everything is formless void and you start to worry that you will be deconstructed too...

rooms.name: Claustrophobic Passage
rooms.description: It's too dark to see; too narrow to breathe.  An oozing slime attaches itself to your clothes, your face...  It gets in your mouth...  YUCK!!

North.description: The boulder seems to have been loosened.

rooms.name: Claustrophobic Passage
rooms.description: It's too dark to see; too narrow to breathe.  An oozing slime attaches itself to your clothes, your face...  It gets in your mouth...  YUCK!!

rooms.name: Claustrophobic Passage
rooms.description: It's too dark to see; too narrow to breathe.  An oozing slime attaches itself to your clothes, your face...  It gets in your mouth...  YUCK!!

rooms.name: Luminous Tunnel
rooms.description: The face of the rock in this narrow tunnel is covered with a moss that emanates an eerie pulsating light.  The walls seem to come alive as you pass by - awakened by your presence, thousands of moss buds explode, sending a green powder in your direction.  Well, at least you won't pass unnoticed in the dark. You can go back to the south if you feel unable to open the gate to the north.

North.description: There's a sturdy iron gate to the north.

rooms.name: Griffin Chapel
rooms.description: To the south a granite altar is visible and to the west there are murals on the walls.  North of here is the entrance to the tunnels that lead to the chapel.

rooms.name: Griffin Chapel
rooms.description: This side of the chapel has colourful murals painted all over the walls. To the east is the exit from the chapel while the murals continue southwards.

extras.text: The murals tell the story of the great griffin god who the cult worship. He seems to have arrived on the island one day after a tour of the universe and decreed this island to be the only place fit for his creatures to live. He created the cave and its altar and killed all the people living on the island who did not accept his authority. The story seems to take place before even the druids were here, or perhaps the painter felt it diplomatic not to paint his master's undefeated enemies.

rooms.name: Griffin Chapel
rooms.description: The murals continue north and you can see an altar to the east.

extras.text: This mural seems more fanciful, as if it tells of the future not the past. Dagon is represented as rising from the altar to destroy his enemies, among whom you can clearly see Earle suffering. Behind Dagon is the shadow of an even larger griffin which seems to be scorching everything it touches. Perhaps it is just that the painter has a bad sense of perspective.

rooms.name: Griffin Chapel
rooms.description: This dome is large enough to hold about fifty worshippers and a large altar in the centre of the room.  There are no obvious seams in the creation of the dome, it is as if it were carved out of the solid rock around the altar, although no tool marks are visible either.

rooms.name: Pentagram Cavern
rooms.description: Dripping stones - stalagtites and stalagmites - adorn this cavern.  As you move through it, their shadows shift unsettlingly.  To the west you can see an altar while to the south you can feel a cold wind blowing, and you can hear the sea against the cliffs.

rooms.name: Cavern
rooms.description: The cavern here becomes wide and flat.  It's walls are covered with ancient cave paintings of mythical animals.  Some bones lie scattered on the floor. North of here the cavern gets darker.  A strong draught enters the cave from the south.

rooms.name: Giant Griffin's Nest
rooms.description: In a way, griffins are birds, too, and it is in a nest that they sleep and raise their young.  This nest, twice the size of, say, the Forest Inn, is built on a rocky ledge overlooking the sea.  The thunder of the waves is at its loudest.  The cavern continues to the north.  The wind here is so strong that you fear that if you could fly south you wouldn't be able to fly back to the cliff.

rooms.name: Swirling Water
rooms.description: The waves crash into the rock with a thunderous roar...  In this narrow bay, with high cliffs east, west and north of you, the boiling turbulence of the sea becomes life-threatening.  To the north you see a giant nest placed on a ledge, but no matter how you try the air currents don't permit you to go in that direction.

rooms.name: Above the Swirling Water
rooms.description: Accidents have a way of happening to those who venture too far from the shore - and what a dangerous piece of shore this is. The power with which the waves crash into the rocks some distance below is just awesome. Leaving down means risking death - but isn't that what you live for?

rooms.name: In The Hollow Tree
rooms.description: It's considerably warmer in here than outside - which seems strange, as you could hardly light a fire inside a tree...  Here and there twigs sprout from the simple furniture.  An exit leads down.

rooms.name: Five Birches House
rooms.description: This is a spacious house, with all the amenities necessary for a luxurious life.  It has that little 'je ne sais quoi' that the other houses don't have. Through a large window you can see a forest of emerald-green trees whose leaves shimmer with moisture from the night's rain.

rooms.name: Suspended House
rooms.description: Hundreds of plants from all over the world fill this plant-nursery.  Placed in flower pots and trays, some of them are only seedlings, while others have grown to a size too big for this house.  Around the stem, a stairway leads to the crown of the tree.

rooms.name: Above the Stone Arch
rooms.description: You merrily float in the air above the stone arch.  South of here you can see an island covered with emerald-green trees.

rooms.name: Above the Stone Arch
rooms.description: You merrily float in the air above the stone arch.  South of here you can see an island covered with emerald-green trees.

rooms.name: Above the Island
rooms.description: West and east lies the shore.  In a more or less southernly direction you see two lakes.  The world looks much prettier from up here...

rooms.name: Flying Over the Northern Path
rooms.description: Looking down to take your bearing, you see the northern path running east to west.

rooms.name: Above the Northern Path
rooms.description: Looking down to take your bearing, you see the northern path running east to west.

rooms.name: Over the Northern Path
rooms.description: Looking down to take your bearing, you see the northern path running east to west.

rooms.name: Above the Northern Path
rooms.description: Looking down to take your bearing, you see the northern path running east to west.

rooms.name: Above the Crystal Megalith
rooms.description: You fly around the sharp point of the crystal megalith below...  The harsh blue light seems to affect your flying skills - in a negative way...

rooms.name: Above the Shore
rooms.description: You swirl about like an accomplished osprey!

rooms.name: Above the Shore
rooms.description: You swirl about like an accomplished osprey!

rooms.name: Above the Shore
rooms.description: You swirl about like an accomplished osprey.

rooms.name: Roof of the Boathouse
rooms.description: You touch down on the roof of the boat house.  You could drop down, or fly east, west or south.

rooms.name: Above the Shore
rooms.description: You swirl about like an accomplished osprey.

rooms.name: In the Air
rooms.description: You fly into a fluffy little cloud, temporarily losing your sense of direction.

rooms.name: Over the Circle of Stone
rooms.description: You get an extra boost from the cosmic energies emanating from the circle of stone below.  Southwest of here is a lake.

rooms.name: In the Air
rooms.description: You fly into a fluffy little cloud, temporarily losing your sense of direction.

rooms.name: Above the Western Beach
rooms.description: You fill your lungs with the fresh sea air...  South of here lies a shipwreck.

rooms.name: Over the Swamp
rooms.description: You smell the swamp gas from the marsh below.

rooms.name: Above Righ Eye Lake
rooms.description: Whee!  At least you'll splash down safely when your fly spell runs out... You did bring a boat, didn't you?

rooms.name: High above the Swirling Water
rooms.description: Up here, the raging sea seems to be too far away to be able to get at you, but remember that falling down is just going to be that more painful.

rooms.name: Above Right Eye Lake
rooms.description: Whee!  At least you'll splash down safely when your fly spell runs out... You did bring a boat, didn't you?

rooms.name: Eliah's Tree
rooms.description: A pinewood cabin nests in the crown of this oak.  As you fly around it, you notice only a few small windows.  The entrance seems to have been made in the floor.

rooms.name: Above the Woods
rooms.description: You are in the air, with a forest below you.

rooms.name: Above Left Eye Lake
rooms.description: Whee!  At least you'll splash down safely when your fly spell runs out... You did bring a boat, didn't you?

rooms.name: In The Living Tree House
rooms.description: Well, reconsidering, this looks like the most primitive of all the houses in this forest, but its inhabitants would probably not agree.  As regards furniture, well, there isn't any, really.  It's just branches and leaves to all sides.

rooms.name: Above Left Eye Lake
rooms.description: Whee!  At least you'll splash down safely when your fly spell runs out... You did bring a boat, didn't you?

rooms.name: Above the Grassland
rooms.description: You dart around in the sky.  Below you is grassland.

rooms.name: In the Air
rooms.description: You float on your back and let a light breeze carry you off in the right direction.

rooms.name: Above the Wreck
rooms.description: From up here, you can take a good look at poor old 'St.  Marvin'.  And what a sorry sight it is!  Only the nameplate has no holes in it!  It makes one want to shake one's head and weep...

rooms.name: Over the Swamp
rooms.description: You smell the swamp gas from the marsh below.

rooms.name: Above Right Eye Lake
rooms.description: Whee!  At least you'll splash down safely when your fly spell runs out... You did bring a boat, didn't you?

rooms.name: Crown of the Holy Oak
rooms.description: Between the oak's own foliage, leaves in a different shade of green are visible.  These are the leaves of the parasite that feeds on the oak's sap : mistletoe.  Without this, the oak would not be revered as much as it is.  It is this mistletoe that is cut with a golden sickle by the eldest druid, and is used in the most powerful potions.

rooms.name: Roof of 'The Five Birches'
rooms.description: Some deck chairs have been put on the spacious roof of the biggest house in the woods.

rooms.name: A Tree with a House
rooms.description: There's a house without much in the way of a roof beneath you.  A stairway leads down.

rooms.name: Above Left Eye Lake
rooms.description: Whee!  At least you'll splash down safely when your fly spell runs out... You did bring a boat, didn't you?

rooms.name: Above the Mushroom Patch
rooms.description: You are high above a patch of colourful mushrooms.

rooms.name: Above the Grassland
rooms.description: You dart around in the sky.  Below you is grassland.

rooms.name: In the Air
rooms.description: You float on your back and let a light breeze carry you off in the right direction.

rooms.name: Above the Hills
rooms.description: Green hills dotted with flowers lie directly below you.

rooms.name: Over the Swamp
rooms.description: You smell the swamp gas from the marsh below.

rooms.name: Above the Trees
rooms.description: As you tear through the sky, your feet brush the tops of the trees, leaving a flutter of leaves in your wake.

rooms.name: Crown of the Living Treehouse
rooms.description: You begin to appreciate why birds like trees so much.  But let's not start singing bird songs, shall we...

rooms.name: Hanging Bridge
rooms.description: This rope bridge connects the suspended house that is more or less east of here with the living tree house west of here.  Don't fall off!

rooms.name: Above the Clearing
rooms.description: Do I spot a landing-zone down there?  Beneath you lies a clearing in the woods.

rooms.name: In the Crown of the Hollow Wood Giant
rooms.description: You fly into the crown of this tree, trying to hide between the leaves.

rooms.name: Over the Herb Garden
rooms.description: You close your eyes and take in a deep breath of air through your nose. You smell all kinds of herbs and spices.

rooms.name: Above the Grassland
rooms.description: You dart around in the air.  Below you is grassland.

rooms.name: In the Air
rooms.description: You float on your back and let a light breeze carry you off in the right direction.

rooms.name: Over the Hills
rooms.description: Green hills dotted with flowers lie directly below you.

rooms.name: Seaside Cliffs
rooms.description: The hills rise away from the sea to become an overhanging cliff here.  You can't see anything from the top apart from sea and you can see no way to climb down either.  The hills continue south, while a marsh lies to the east and a beach to the north.

extras.text: There is a stake in the ground here, if only you had a rope you could climb down.

rooms.name: Roof of Brother Crowley's House
rooms.description: Grass grows on this roof made with planks that are covered with dirt.  By the look of it, they were salvaged from a shipwreck.

rooms.name: In the Air
rooms.description: A light breeze toys with your hair.  It feels good to get that weight off your feet!

rooms.name: Above the Trees
rooms.description: As you tear through the sky, your feet brush the tops of the trees, leaving a flutter of leaves in your wake.

rooms.name: Above the Trees
rooms.description: As you tear through the sky, your feet brush the tops of the trees, leaving a flutter of leaves in your wake.

rooms.name: Above some Trees
rooms.description: You're able to make out a dirt path between the trees below you.

rooms.name: Above the Crater
rooms.description: From up here the crater below looks even more impressive.  The explosion has completely disintegrated a piece of forest the size of a large house.

rooms.name: Above the Grassland
rooms.description: You dart around in the air.  Below you is grassland.

rooms.name: Top of Hanging Rock
rooms.description: You need to pull up sharply in order not to crash into this giant rock.

rooms.name: In the Air
rooms.description: You float on your back and let a light breeze carry you off in the right direction.

rooms.name: Above the Cave-In
rooms.description: Below you, you can see where part of the island has crumbled into the sea.

rooms.name: Over the Dead Forest
rooms.description: You exhibit some cool flying skills, enough to make even a proud griffin jealous.

rooms.name: Over the Dead Forest
rooms.description: You exhibit some cool flying skills, enough to make even a proud griffin jealous.

rooms.name: Over the Dead Forest
rooms.description: You exhibit some cool flying skill, enough to make even a proud griffin jealous.

rooms.name: Over the Dead Forest

rooms.name: Over the Dead Forest
rooms.description: You exhibit some cool flying skills, enough to make even a proud griffin jealous.

rooms.name: Above the Ancient Monument
rooms.description: You hover above the massive stone head that stands here forever looking south.

rooms.name: Above the Beacon Fire
rooms.description: Uche Uche!  The smoke from the fire below stings your eyes and gets into your lungs.  Mayday, mayday...

rooms.name: Above the Island
rooms.description: You are floating over the southwestern shore of the island.

rooms.name: High above the Bay
rooms.description: While you're here, get yourself a breath of fresh air!  Below you and some distance to the south lies a narrow bay.

rooms.name: Over Griffin Ground
rooms.description: You are hunting high and low above griffin ground...  But who is the hunter, and who is the hunted?

rooms.name: Above the Hollow
rooms.description: You are caressed by a sweet little breeze.

rooms.name: Above the Hollow
rooms.description: You are caressed by a sweet little breeze.

rooms.name: Over Griffin Ground
rooms.description: You are hunting high and low above griffin ground...  But who is the hunter, and who is the hunted?

rooms.name: Over the Cliffs
rooms.description: A strong southern gale puts your feet above your head.

rooms.name: Over the Cliffs
rooms.description: A strong southern gale puts your feet above your head.

rooms.name: Over the Cliffs
rooms.description: A strong southern gale puts your feet above your head.

rooms.name: Over the Cliffs
rooms.description: A strong southern gale puts your feet above your head.

rooms.name: Above Panorama Point
rooms.description: And here the view is even better!  Staying airborne is tiring though, for you have to lean hard into the wind to stay put.  South of here you can see a small rocky island separated from Griffin Isle.

rooms.name: Above Sentinel Rock
rooms.description: You're gliding in the air above Sentinel Rock.

rooms.name: Sea
rooms.description: You're up to your middle in the waves, and sinking slowly...  North and south of here are black cliffs.

rooms.name: North Of Sentinel Rock
rooms.description: You're in the air.  Below is the sea, north a cliff and south Sentinel Rock.

rooms.name: South Of Panorama Point
rooms.description: You're above the sea.  South of here and down lies an islet.  Griffin Isle is to the north.

rooms.name: Deep in the Cave
rooms.description: Deeper in the cave there seems to have been an attempt to make some sort of living quarters.  A sad looking straw sack lies against one wall and a rudimentary set of weights is scattered around the floor.

rooms.name: The Entrance to the Cave
rooms.description: The cave is long and narrow and dark, and doesn't seem to go back into the cliff very far.

rooms.name: In The Boat House
rooms.description: The interior of the boathouse is quite clean for an abandoned structure. Obviously someone still uses it, although given the basic amenities on show probably not someone who cares for the finer things in life.

rooms.name: Cabin
rooms.description: It's a pretty mess in here!  Eliah, a confirmed bachelor, has better things to do than beating the carpet and picking up his dirty laundry!  A glint on the wall catches your eye.

extras.text: A horrendous monster raises its fist to attack you! Aw no, hold it, it's just your mirror image.

rooms.name: An Unfamiliar Plane
rooms.description: You are having trouble making sense of up and down on this plane, there seems to be no horizon and colours shift before your eyes.  Perhaps being here is not such a good idea for a mortal.

extras.text: There seems to be an anomoly here, perhaps a small rift exists?
